content:
1
ITEM NO.28               COURT NO.12               SECTION IV-C
               S U P R E M E  C O U R T  O F  I N D I A
                       RECORD OF PROCEEDINGS
SPECIAL LEAVE PETITION (CIVIL) Diary No(s). 17958/2025
[Arising out of impugned final judgment and order dated  04-10-2024
in WA No. 639/2024 passed by the High Court of Chhatisgarh at 
Bilaspur]
STATE OF CHHATTISGARH & ORS.                       Petitioner(s)
                                VERSUS
PARAS RAM YADAV                                    Respondent(s)
IA No. 149805/2025 - CONDONATION OF DELAY IN FILING
IA No. 149808/2025 - CONDONATION OF DELAY IN REFILING /  CURING THE
DEFECTS
IA No. 149806/2025 - EXEMPTION FROM FILING O.T.
IA No. 149807/2025 - PERMISSION TO FILE ADDITIONAL 
DOCUMENTS/FACTS/ANNEXURES
 
Date : 07-07-2025 This matter was called on for hearing today.
CORAM :  HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE PANKAJ MITHAL
         HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE K.V. VISWANATHAN
[PARTIAL COURT WORKING DAYS BENCH]
For Petitioner(s)  Mr. Bishwajit Dubey, A.A.G.
                   Mr. Vinayak Sharma, Standing Counsel, Adv.
                   Mr. Ravinder Kumar Yadav, AOR
                   Mr. Vivek Sharma, Adv.   
                               
For Respondent(s)
          UPON hearing the counsel the Court made the following
                             O R D E R
1. Heard learned counsel for the State of Chhattisgarh.
2. Delay condoned. IA Nos. 149805 and 149808 of 2025 are allowed.
3. In the facts and circumstances of the case, we do not consider
it necessary to interfere with the order impugned.
4. Accordingly, the Special  Leave Petition is dismissed, leaving
the question of law, if any, open to be decided in accordance with
law in an appropriate case.2
5. Pending application(s), if any, shall stand disposed of.
(VARSHA MENDIRATTA)                             (NIDHI MATHUR)
COURT MASTER (SH)                             COURT MASTER (NSH)
